DataElement.preferredName: Prostate Gland Precancerous Condition Histopathologic Examination Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The subcategory of prostate carcinoma defined by the microscopic and cytologic tissue abnormality characteristics.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prostate Gland Precancerous Condition Histopathologic Examination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen._A pathological process with signs indicating it may become cancerous.  Representative examples include leukoplakia, dysplastic nevus, actinic keratosis, xeroderma pigmentosum, and intraepithelial neoplasia._The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A gland in the male reproductive system just below the bladder. It surrounds part of the urethra, the canal that empties the bladder. It produces a fluid that forms part of semen. (NCI-GLOSS)

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathological processes that tend eventually to become malignant. (From Dorland, 27th ed):The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

Concepts.definition: A pathological process with signs indicating it may become cancerous.  Representative examples include leukoplakia, dysplastic nevus, actinic keratosis, xeroderma pigmentosum, and intraepithelial neoplasia.
The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/28/22 mr Released per SME.   9/28/21 mr Created for MCL prostate.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Prostate Gland Precancerous Condition Histopathologic Examination Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen._A pathological process with signs indicating it may become cancerous.  Representative examples include leukoplakia, dysplastic nevus, actinic keratosis, xeroderma pigmentosum, and intraepithelial neoplasia._The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of sheets of malignant epithelial cells punctuated by gland-like spaces in a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of sheets of malignant epithelial cells punctuated by gland-like spaces in a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of a cellular infiltrate with papillary growth in a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of a cellular infiltrate with papillary growth in a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of xanthomatous cells in a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of xanthomatous cells in a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of a cellular infiltrate without a papillary growth in a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic finding indicating the presence of a cellular infiltrate without a papillary growth in a tissue sample.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Top level term which includes Biological Markers, Risk Factors, and Prognostic Factors.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

A pathological process with signs indicating it may become cancerous.  Representative examples include leukoplakia, dysplastic nevus, actinic keratosis, xeroderma pigmentosum, and intraepithelial neoplasia.
